Posts.Content: You can review my history (story) in signature. A few weeks ago I had bone scan and abdominal CT scan - both came back negative for metastasis/growth. Of course the PSA number and the velocity of rise (since the Lupron cessation) is a concern. My doc suggested PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan. (I go to Cleveland Clinic). Well, Anthem denied the scan after the peer-to-peer. So I don’t know how much I can fight it, but my insurance guy and I will try. I’m asymptotic - I think. Years of sports and the Army have taken their toll ... so what ache and pain is normal or not .. who knows at this point. Lol. I’m researching the cost. I have no idea what the scan costs but trying to get info from Cleveland. My questions: A) anyone else have this scan? Anyone’s thoughts? B) if I don’t do the scan or scan comes back neagative, what should I do? Continued PSA maybe monthly? Bone and CT scan monthly? I know my age, and the ridiculous PSA/Gleason numbers point towards the crap side of the bell curve. My doc said he reviewed the stats on 2,000 cases and found 20 that were close to mine. But this is the 4th time in my life the doctors have either said, “it’s in God’s hands” or “get your affairs together”. (Cleveland has not said this though) Different illnesses/maladies. Not cancer. But I beat em all. So ... at least it’s not my first rodeo ... This whole ordeal is a trip. It’s now like - well .... let’s just see what happens. Lol. The doc is wonderful and good, Cleveland is great. I’ve spent hours with people there (and my own research ... I’m not in the medical field but been around it my whole life and am an engineer) and PC just seems to be a mother when it comes to progression and foresight. Depending on cost of scan (if anyone knows ballpark cost please let me know) I will do it. But any advice would be great. I’ve learned to always listen to others. With Cleveland, we are waiting to see if I can get anywhere with insurance. Next week we speak to game plan with scan or no scan. So any input here would be awesome. Thank you very much and bless you all. And thanks for this resource.
Posts.Signature: -Age: 52, b. 1965 -Dec 2014 tore adductor muscle off pelvis (playing hockey) (injury not related to PC confirmed later) -MRI for injury revealed enlarged prostate, initial PSA Dec 2014: 86 -Had surgery to reattach muscle and had another PSA test Jan 2015 (we thought initial test was screwed up): PSA now 128 -Gleason: 7s, 8s, and few 9s in 9/14 cores (two different, unassociated labs) -Feb 2015, aborted prostatectomy (cancer outside around urethra) - lymphs looked bad in region, but biopsy from 2 labs said negative -Feb 2015, started Lupron -April 2015, beam radiation treatment -Feb 2017 came off Lupron PSA History 12/14 - 86 1/15 - 128 On Lupron 6/15 - .72 8/15 - .63 2/16 - .24 8/16 - .09 2/17 - .04 Off Lupron 6/17 - .20 8/17 - .30 12/17 - 1.1 2/18 - 2.91 4/18 - 4.4 5/18 - 5.44 7/18 - 10.6 8/18 - 10.6
Posts.Title: Need advice - PSA nuts again and what about PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DjinTonic Hi Deuce, I'll let those with first-hand experience with the newer scans respond to that. I'm no expert either, but a few questions: An abdominal CT can usually visualize the top part of the pelvis, but are you sure you didn't have a pelvic CT also? Or even a chest, abdomen, and pelvis? Sorry. Yes on pelvis and abdomen. I am not sure but I dont think the chest. I will confirm would make sense to do chest Do you remember how many lymph nodes were removed during your surgery? 2 closest to the prostate Why wasn't the Lupron restarted when your PSA began its last rise? Or some other form of HT? What has your doc said about treatment options going forward? Thanks for your help and response. Moving forward he said lets do the fancy test first. We debated the Lupron back in June but testosterone was really low. If we dont do another test we probably start Lupron again. Arggg lol. He did say in normal cases  like PSAs in high single or mid-range single (at diagnosis) he would but starting so high its somewhat of an anomaly. I know. Numbers for PSA and Gleason are ridiculous. Lol. Researching on here and other studies, etc I dont find too many as high as mine got. Ive got call with them this week. Hoping to gather more insight here to ask them. They see so many cases etc there that theyre exposed to more situations ... but ... damn, I tell people who understand these numbers and I get that look ... lol. Thanks for help !

Posts.Content: Thanks Prato. I will look into that trial. And yes, that’s my concern with the PSA so high. I know it likes to go to the bones or lymph’s - usual spots ... but ... it can and does sometimes go elsewhere. Of course my doc doesn’t like the PSA so high, but says since mine started at 128 he’s has seen extraordinarily high PSAs act on scale. But stats say that’s also rare. Thanks for,the help!

Posts.Content: I just got off an email with the PA. Lol. To your points Michael (and Djin) - he said almost exactly what you just said. About pinpointing and new treatments. He added that starting the Lupron again now immediately can actually mess up the tests. I will look into these other tests as well. The PA said he will work this week to figure out this testing and insurance crap. Actually went through this with Anthem and the beam radiation and in the end they did it. Just typical bureaucratic dance. Lol Thanks again!

Posts.Title: Need advice - PSA nuts again and what about PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DjinTonic Deuce, regarding your insurance: they initially said no to the RT??? They wanted your G9 to go untreated? What am I missing?i No. Sorry for the confusion. I had beam radiation 3 years ago. They are saying no to this new scan. Just got off call with doc. With PSA rising again and fast, obviously something is going on ... and he wants to find out what. Being so young, he doesn’t want to jump on ADT until we know what/where it may be ... and treat that. Doesn’t want me getting ADT resistant. Originally Posted by cvictim Continued PSA maybe monthly? Bone and CT scan monthly? Monthly PSA is a good thing. A monthly SCan is very harsh, the Scan technician told me one scan is equivalent to 100 x-rays. Lets face it your body can only tolerate so much. I have noticed lots of problems in pelvic and abdomen region. Are these problems from all the scans; its got me thinking Aye. That’s why he wants full body now. Puzzling insurance is pushing back especially with the marker numbers. In mind mind it would be cheaper to find the issue now ... looking at their cost outlay overall. Who knows. Thx all for,help !

Bone and CT scan monthly? Monthly PSA is a good thing. A monthly SCan is very harsh, the Scan technician told me one scan is equivalent to 100 x-rays. Lets face it your body can only tolerate so much. I have noticed lots of problems in pelvic and abdomen region. Are these problems from all the scans; its got me thinking Aye. That’s why he wants full body now. Puzzling insurance is pushing back especially with the marker numbers. In mind mind it would be cheaper to find the issue now ... looking at their cost outlay overall. Who knows. Thx all for,help !
Posts.Signature: -Age: 52, b. 1965 -Dec 2014 tore adductor muscle off pelvis (playing hockey) (injury not related to PC confirmed later) -MRI for injury revealed enlarged prostate, initial PSA Dec 2014: 86 -Had surgery to reattach muscle and had another PSA test Jan 2015 (we thought initial test was screwed up): PSA now 128 -Gleason: 7s, 8s, and few 9s in 9/14 cores (two different, unassociated labs) -Feb 2015, aborted prostatectomy (cancer outside around urethra) - lymphs looked bad in region, but biopsy from 2 labs said negative -Feb 2015, started Lupron -April 2015, beam radiation treatment -Feb 2017 came off Lupron PSA History 12/14 - 86 1/15 - 128 On Lupron 6/15 - .72 8/15 - .63 2/16 - .24 8/16 - .09 2/17 - .04 Off Lupron 6/17 - .20 8/17 - .30 12/17 - 1.1 2/18 - 2.91 4/18 - 4.4 5/18 - 5.44 7/18 - 10.6 8/18 - 10.6
Posts.Title: Need advice - PSA nuts again and what about PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan

Posts.Content: You can review my history (story) in signature. A few weeks ago I had bone scan and abdominal CT scan - both came back negative for metastasis/growth. Of course the PSA number and the velocity of rise (since the Lupron cessation) is a concern. My doc suggested PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan. (I go to Cleveland Clinic). Well, Anthem denied the scan after the peer-to-peer. So I don’t know how much I can fight it, but my insurance guy and I will try. I’m asymptotic - I think. Years of sports and the Army have taken their toll ... so what ache and pain is normal or not .. who knows at this point. Lol. I’m researching the cost. I have no idea what the scan costs but trying to get info from Cleveland. My questions: A) anyone else have this scan? Anyone’s thoughts? B) if I don’t do the scan or scan comes back neagative, what should I do? Continued PSA maybe monthly? Bone and CT scan monthly? I know my age, and the ridiculous PSA/Gleason numbers point towards the crap side of the bell curve. My doc said he reviewed the stats on 2,000 cases and found 20 that were close to mine. But this is the 4th time in my life the doctors have either said, “it’s in God’s hands” or “get your affairs together”. (Cleveland has not said this though) Different illnesses/maladies. Not cancer. But I beat em all. So ... at least it’s not my first rodeo ... This whole ordeal is a trip. It’s now like - well .... let’s just see what happens. Lol. The doc is wonderful and good, Cleveland is great. I’ve spent hours with people there (and my own research ... I’m not in the medical field but been around it my whole life and am an engineer) and PC just seems to be a mother when it comes to progression and foresight. Depending on cost of scan (if anyone knows ballpark cost please let me know) I will do it. But any advice would be great. I’ve learned to always listen to others. With Cleveland, we are waiting to see if I can get anywhere with insurance. Next week we speak to game plan with scan or no scan. So any input here would be awesome. Thank you very much and bless you all. And thanks for this resource.

Posts.Title: Need advice - PSA nuts again and what about PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DjinTonic Hi Deuce, I'll let those with first-hand experience with the newer scans respond to that. I'm no expert either, but a few questions: An abdominal CT can usually visualize the top part of the pelvis, but are you sure you didn't have a pelvic CT also? Or even a chest, abdomen, and pelvis? Sorry. Yes on pelvis and abdomen. I am not sure but I dont think the chest. I will confirm would make sense to do chest Do you remember how many lymph nodes were removed during your surgery? 2 closest to the prostate Why wasn't the Lupron restarted when your PSA began its last rise? Or some other form of HT? What has your doc said about treatment options going forward? Thanks for your help and response. Moving forward he said lets do the fancy test first. We debated the Lupron back in June but testosterone was really low. If we dont do another test we probably start Lupron again. Arggg lol. He did say in normal cases  like PSAs in high single or mid-range single (at diagnosis) he would but starting so high its somewhat of an anomaly. I know. Numbers for PSA and Gleason are ridiculous. Lol. Researching on here and other studies, etc I dont find too many as high as mine got. Ive got call with them this week. Hoping to gather more insight here to ask them. They see so many cases etc there that theyre exposed to more situations ... but ... damn, I tell people who understand these numbers and I get that look ... lol. Thanks for help !

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DjinTonic Deuce, regarding your insurance: they initially said no to the RT??? They wanted your G9 to go untreated? What am I missing?i No. Sorry for the confusion. I had beam radiation 3 years ago. They are saying no to this new scan. Just got off call with doc. With PSA rising again and fast, obviously something is going on ... and he wants to find out what. Being so young, he doesn’t want to jump on ADT until we know what/where it may be ... and treat that. Doesn’t want me getting ADT resistant. Originally Posted by cvictim Continued PSA maybe monthly? Bone and CT scan monthly? Monthly PSA is a good thing. A monthly SCan is very harsh, the Scan technician told me one scan is equivalent to 100 x-rays. Lets face it your body can only tolerate so much. I have noticed lots of problems in pelvic and abdomen region. Are these problems from all the scans; its got me thinking Aye. That’s why he wants full body now. Puzzling insurance is pushing back especially with the marker numbers. In mind mind it would be cheaper to find the issue now ... looking at their cost outlay overall. Who knows. Thx all for,help !

Posts.Title: Need advice - PSA nuts again and what about PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan

Posts.Content: Thanks Prato. I will look into that trial. And yes, that’s my concern with the PSA so high. I know it likes to go to the bones or lymph’s - usual spots ... but ... it can and does sometimes go elsewhere. Of course my doc doesn’t like the PSA so high, but says since mine started at 128 he’s has seen extraordinarily high PSAs act on scale. But stats say that’s also rare. Thanks for,the help!
